  • Assure quality and contribute to testing of deliverables
  • Has a growth mind-set: curious to explore, eager to learn and finding better ways, as well as and energised by sharing.
  • Collaborate with Product Team or area to understand needs and devise possible solutions
  • Support a culture of data-driven decision making for Retail Concept Operations business domain

Additional Information

This position is full-time (40 hours per week) and is located in Malmö, Sweden. Some travel will be required.

Please send your application – CV in English latest 12th of May 2025. We really want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work at IKEA and why you would be a good fit for this role.

In this role you will be reporting to the Competence Hub Development Manager.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Reliant

We believe that making the best decisions means looking at all the facts - a near-impossible task in our era of information overload. To fix this, we are building the next generation of machine learning software. Powered by generative AI, our algorithms analyze key information sources and provide comprehensive, factual answers for even your most complex queries.

We believe that the transformative impact of generative AI will be only realized by those willing to take on the world's biggest information challenges. To make this future come true, we deploy our longstanding expertise in reinforcement learning and natural language processing.

We are scientists. Builders. Entrepreneurs. We spearheaded many of AI's most impactful applications. We led teams at Google, DeepMind, and EY Parthenon. We now bridge cutting-edge AI research and the biopharma industry.

About The Role

We are looking for a Machine Learning engineer with a strong track record working on applied ML. Bonus points if you have worked in the life sciences. You'll play a central role in defining and building our ML platform, enabling cutting-edge AI agents that excel at discovering and organizing knowledge. Your work will help lay the foundation for a new way of working with data.

If you are passionate about applying AI to real-world problems, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are excited about contributing to the growth of an ambitious startup, we'd love to hear from you.

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)

Your day to day work will mainly include building text based generative AI applications end-to-end with a strong focus on benchmarking and experimentation with models, prompts and system design. Also there are ample opportunities to dive deeper into topics, such as synthetic data generation, model distillation, training embedding models for retrieval, etc.

Am I a good fit?

Ask yourself the following questions:


How does a transformer work?
What is an embedding?
What is a dataclass in Python?
What is a quick way to share an interactive demo with colleagues?


If you find these questions straightforward and can explain at least three of the answers clearly, you're likely a good fit for this role.

We'd love to see


A Master's degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering or a similar quantitative field — or equivalent practical experience. Bonus if you have NLP or reinforcement learning experience
Proven experience implementing practical ML algorithms and scaling them to millions of datapoints
3+ years of experience developing in Python
Familiarity with at least one ML framework such as PyTorch, JAX, TensorFlow, or similar
Bonus: Experience applying AI to the life sciences or related fields
Bonus: Familiarity with cloud tooling around one or more of CI/CD, dockerization, model serving, data processing


We're hiring across experience levels, from junior to senior, and will calibrate the role and responsibilities based on your background and expertise.

What We Offer

We're building a high-impact, mission-driven company — and we want our team to share in that success. Here's what we offer:


An amazing team - work with curious, ambitious people who genuinely care about solving meaningful problems
Competitive Salary tailored to your experience and the role level
Equity / Stock Options — meaningful ownership in the company's future
Generous Paid Time Off — including 27 vacation days
On-site Work Arrangements with Flexibility — on-site first culture with regular days for remote work
Learning & Development Budget — for books, courses, or conferences that help you grow
Fast Growth Environment — be part of shaping both the technology and the company from the ground up
Regular Team Retreats — we bring the team together at least once a year to collaborate and have fun


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

If you find these questions straightforward and can explain at least three of the answers clearly, you're likely a good fit for this role.

We'd love to see

  • A Master's degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering or a similar quantitative field — or equivalent practical experience. Bonus if you have NLP or reinforcement learning experience
  • Proven experience implementing practical ML algorithms and scaling them to millions of datapoints
  • 3+ years of experience developing in Python
  • Familiarity with at least one ML framework such as PyTorch, JAX, TensorFlow, or similar
  • Bonus: Experience applying AI to the life sciences or related fields
  • Bonus: Familiarity with cloud tooling around one or more of CI/CD, dockerization, model serving, data processing

We're hiring across experience levels, from junior to senior, and will calibrate the role and responsibilities based on your background and expertise.

What We Offer

We're building a high-impact, mission-driven company — and we want our team to share in that success. Here's what we offer:

  • An amazing team - work with curious, ambitious people who genuinely care about solving meaningful problems
  • Competitive Salary tailored to your experience and the role level
  • Equity / Stock Options — meaningful ownership in the company's future
  • Generous Paid Time Off — including 27 vacation days
  • On-site Work Arrangements with Flexibility — on-site first culture with regular days for remote work
  • Learning & Development Budget — for books, courses, or conferences that help you grow
  • Fast Growth Environment — be part of shaping both the technology and the company from the ground up
  • Regular Team Retreats — we bring the team together at least once a year to collaborate and have fun

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Die Mission von Titanom Solutions ist es die Bildung durch KI smarter und zugänglicher zu machen und den Lernprozess so zu gestalten, dass jede in Europa lebende Person mindestens ein "Aha"-Moment mehr erfährt. Mit modernsten Technologien entwickeln wir Softwarelösungen - von KI-gestützten Bildungsmedien bis hin zu intelligenten Plattformen für personalisiertes Lernen.

Als Machine Learning Engineer bei Titanom bist du Teil unseres agilen Entwicklungsteams und arbeitest an der Entwicklung moderner KI-Lösungen, die den Lernprozess von vielen Menschen verändern. Du kombinierst deine Leidenschaft für sauberen Code mit deiner Begeisterung für nutzerzentrierte Produkte, um innovative Anwendungen zu schaffen, die unsere Nutzer*innen begeistern als auch einen echten Mehrwert bieten. Dabei wirkst du in einem dynamischen Umfeld, das kreative Ansätze und technologisches Know-how fordert. Auf folgende Weise schaffst du einen spürbaren Mehrwert:

Aufgaben:


Begleitung von KI-Anwendungen von der Konzeption über die Implementierung bis hin zum Release
Implementierung von Semantic Search und Finetuning von Large Language Models (LLM)
Einrichten von RAG-Anwendungen, Implementierung von Semantic Search und Skalierbaren, effizienten Datenpipelines
Stetige Evaluation und Weiterentwicklung vorhandener KI-Modelle
Qualitätssicherung der Modellergebnisse und neuer Features mittels Unit- und Integrationstest
Research zu neuen Technologien
Teilnahme an Software Engineering, Machine Learning Workshops (wöchentlich), um kontinuierlich zu lernen und den Horizont zu erweitern
Einsatz für die Verbesserung der Developer Experience, um die Produktivität und Zufriedenheit des Teams weiter zu steigern



Requirements


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Machine Learning, Informatik, Künstliche Intelligenz, Mathematik oder einer vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich Machine Learning und KI-Technologie sowie praktische Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung
Gute Kenntnisse in Python und Web-Frameworks (z.B. FastAPI, Flask oder Django)
Effizienter Umgang mit Datenbanken sowie Kenntnisse in PostgreSQL
Erfahrung mit ML-Bibliotheken wie PyTorch und Transformers
Leidenschaft für moderne Technologien, Drive und Spirit sowie Hands-On Mentalität
Fließende Deutsch- (min. C1) und Englischkenntnisse (min. B2)



Benefits


Flexible Arbeitszeiten und 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr? Na klar, Hauptsache die Ergebnisse stimmen!
Mitarbeiter*innen Beteiligungsprogramm: Durch virtuelle Aktien profitierst DU direkt vom Wachstum und TITANOMS zukünftigen Erfolg!
Überstundenvergütung: Jede Minute wird nicht nur anerkannt, sondern auch wertgeschätz!
10% Education Time: Wir unterstützen dich dabei, kontinuierlich zu lernen und zu wachsen!
Eine flache Hierarchie, in der es okay ist, auch dem CEO ein paar klare Worte zu sagen? Absolut
Komplette Freiheit bei Tools und Geräten? Alles außer Windows!
Ein phänomenales und gut erreichbares Büro mit Gym, Sauna, Nintendo, Tischtennis, Kickertisch, Schlaf-/Ruheraum und Dachterrasse? Überzeuge Dich selbst!
Ein Kühlschrank voll mit deinen Lieblingsgetränken? Wir bieten eine umfangreiche Getränke-Flat!
Legendäre Firmenfeiern und spannende Events, die du so schnell nicht vergessen wirst? Darauf kannst du wetten!
Ständig neue Aufstiegschancen in einem Unternehmen, das sich jedes Jahr verdoppelt? Wir wachsen zusammen.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Data Scientist.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Develop Data-Driven Insights: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights from large and diverse datasets across different European markets, driving strategic marketing decisions and commercial execution optimization.
Utilising ML methods (e.g supervised, unsupervised) on an Azure platform with languages such as Python, build and implement Predictive Models: Design, build, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to identify market trends, customer behaviour, and business process outcomes.
Analyze Multi-Channel Marketing Data: Integrate and analyze data from various marketing channels (e.g., transactional, firmographic, behavioral, digital data from advertising, social media, email campaigns) to assess performance, identify patterns, generate usable segmentations and recommend improvements to amplify future success of activities.
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with marketing, sales, and data teams to ensure alignment of data science initiatives with business goals. Enable analysts to further work on data points and reach data-driven recommendations to support in strategic planning and decision-making processes.
Ensure compliance to the Machine Learning Lifecycle from Data gathering through to Deployment. Appropriate checks and balances along with sufficient validation steps should be incorporated to maintain Data Quality and Compliance (e.g. GDPR and internal data governance policies)


What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Advanced Data Analysis and Modeling: Proficiency in statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, with experience in coding with Python, R, and SQL along with a good knowledge of Databricks is important. Knowledge of tools like Power BI for translating data into insights is a benefit.
Experience with Marketing Analytics: Strong background in analyzing and interpreting marketing data, with knowledge of marketing metrics, customer segmentation, and business performance evaluation.
Multi-Channel Data Integration: Expertise in integrating and analyzing data from various sources, including digital marketing platforms, CRM systems, large transactional databases, to create in depth intelligent views of customer cohorts.
Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders, including creating detailed reports, visualizations, and presentations.
Cross-Cultural and Regional Awareness: Understanding of the nuances and variations in marketing practices and consumer behavior across different European markets, with the ability to adapt strategies to diverse regional needs.


What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

Our Company

FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di persone motivate, appassionate ed interessate a far parte di un gruppo dove ognuno potrà contribuire attivamente al raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali.

Per la nostra sede di Roma, in particolare per la B.U. Data Analytics, stiamo cercando:

Data Engineer
Data Scientist




La risorsa, inserita in un team di professionisti del settore, si occuperà di attività di analisi e sviluppo di soluzioni applicative in ambito Data Analytics, verrà coinvolta in stimolanti progetti e inserita in un percorso di carriera improntato alla crescita sia professionale che economica.




Sede di lavoro: Roma, Milano e Napoli, con possibilità di smartworking.




Il candidato ideale dovrà essere in grado di svolgere le seguenti attività:

Progettazione e sviluppo soluzioni AI scalabili
Ottimizzione algoritmi e modelli di Machine Learning
Gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita dei progetti AI, dal business discovery al deployment
Implementazione pipeline di dati efficienti
Collaborazione con il team di Data Science per industrializzare i modelli
Metodologie DevOps e MLOps)




Competenze richieste:

Power BI (anche row level security)
Analysis Services
SSRS
SQL
Databricks
Python
PySpark
Apache Spark
Tensorflow
Pytorch
Generative AI
Airflow
Scala
Cloud Functions
BigQuery
Kibana
Elastic Search
AWS
Azure Cloud
GCP




Al candidato chiederemo le seguenti caratteristiche:

ottime capacità relazionali e comunicative
ottima propensione a lavorare per obiettivi ed in tempi molto ristretti
motivazione e determinazione, maturità, autonomia, forte spirito di iniziativa/proattività e dinamismo
Problem determination & problem solving




Completano il profilo del candidato:

laurea in discipline ad indirizzo scientifico o economico
buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata.







Inquadramento e retribuzione indicativi:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Retribuzione commisurata alla reale esperienza maturata




Se interessati, inviate il Vostro Curriculum Vitae aggiornato e dettagliato che dovrà contenere autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati secondo l'articolo 13 GDPR679/16 a: livia.prettico@atoninformatica.it.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ready to find your perfect job fit?

Welcome to HomeBuddy, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US.

What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools.

This job is for you if


You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values.
You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated
You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result



This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility.

Your future tasks will include


Developing and implementing machine learning models to refine lead scoring, identify customer segments, maximize conversions, optimize advertising bids, and prevent churn
Utilize geospatial and socioeconomic data to build predictive models that identify high-value audiences, leaving the competition in our dust
Design and implement pricing & distribution optimization algorithms that maximize lead conversion rates and minimize customer acquisition costs, ensuring we're always in the black
Collaborate seamlessly with marketing, sales, and product teams, translating data-driven insights into actionable campaigns
Present data findings with clarity, conciseness, and a dash of statistical humor, leaving stakeholders nodding in agreement



You're going to need this to be successful in this role


Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Methods or a Related Field
5+ years of experience in the data domain with +2 in data science roles
Expertise in SQL, Python, and Machine Learning frameworks (especially supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms)
Proven experience deploying machine learning models to production environments using tools and frameworks like ML Flow & AWS Sagemaker, ensuring our models are always ready for prime time
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
Fluent English



It's nice if you also have


Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application



Why choose HomeBuddy


Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success.
Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences



If this sounds like you, we should talk!

Privacy Policy

By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click here.
Show more

  • Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
  • A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
  • Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
  • Fluent English


It's nice if you also have

  • Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
  • We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application


Why choose HomeBuddy

  • Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
  • Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
  • Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
  • Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
  • Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success.
  • Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
  • Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences


If this sounds like you, we should talk!

Privacy Policy

By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click here.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
As the Data Science Hub Europe in Nestle, we continuously search for new talents to join our international team dedicated to delivering efficient and high-quality data solutions. In your role of a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with fellow Data Scientists , Analysts and Engineers to drive innovation and develop top-notch analytical models and methods. Your skill, competence and creativity will directly support and impact critical business decisions in areas of supply chain and marketing.

In this role you will:


Actively participate in each stage of the data science lifecycle, from business understanding through model development to industrialization
Design, build and maintain statistical/machine learning models to optimize business operations
Explore and experiment with innovative ML techniques and approaches to maximize value generated by the team
Be a thought leader in development of methodology within big scale transformational projects
Communicate model & analysis results to a non-technical audience that includes stakeholders and senior management, and win their buy-in
Coach and mentor other team members on multiple aspects of a data scientist role


You are the right candidate if you bring along:


2+ years of professional experience building and industrializing machine learning solutions
Proficiency in at least one language employed in ML & statistical analysis (Python or R preferred) and its use with version control (git) and testing
Practical knowledge of SQL
Experience in application of ML concepts and methodologies (regression and classification, time series modeling, feature engineering and selection, regularization etc.)
Solid knowledge of ML techniques and algorithms (incl. various regression types, ensembles, clustering, decision trees, boosting, etc.) and their pros and cons
Ability to reframe business challenges into data science problems and adjust ML methods & tools accordingly
Good communication and presentation skills, in particular facilitation of grasping complex topics by broad audiences, incl. non-technical stakeholders
Track record of effective collaboration with IT / data engineering teams in development and production phase


You will draw even more our attention if you have:


Databricks & PySpark expertise
Broad familiarity with visualization tools (Power BI, R Shiny, etc.) and solutions based on them
Experience in cross-functional and/or international projects
Interest in codifying and disseminating knowledge & best practices, incl. documentation of projects


In return we offer:


Exciting work in a multi-cultural team of bright minds – data lovers and practitioners
Flexible remote work options, or – if your prefer – access to a modern office in Warsaw’s Mokotów, walking distance from Metro Wilanowska
Internal training programs and access to external knowledge resources aimed at expanding your skills and competence
Support in building your ML skills and portfolio through participation and presenting at conferences and events
Opportunities to develop further in our Data Science Hub as well as in the international organization
Option of full-time contract
All kinds of juicy fringe benefits: private medical care, pension fund, cafeteria program, Multisport card, co-financing of meals in the company's canteen, discounts for Nestle products …


We are Nestlé, the largest food and beverage company. We are 308,000 employees strong driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic inclusive international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions and geographies, working with diverse teams and cultures. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.

Nestlé is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please talk to your recruiter so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Scientist

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or AI.
Proficiency in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch);
Strong understanding of statistics, probability, and data modeling.
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Snowflake, etc.).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their ML services.
Experience working with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Databricks).
Familiarity with MLOps, version control (Git), and CI/CD for model deployment.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Fluent in english;
The candidate has to be in Portugal and open to a hybrid position.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Data Scientist - Advanced Analytics Madrid
Description:
¿Te imaginas participando en la transformación de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales?

En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti.

Durante tu día a día, te encargarás, entre otras cosas, de...

Si decides unirte a nosotros, trabajarás con un equipo de expertos en inteligencia artificial, datos y analítica. Esperamos que puedas aportar tus ganas e ilusión para compartir tus conocimientos en tecnología y análisis con el objetivo de crear soluciones que permitan generar valor para nuestros clientes.

Trabajamos para compañías de gran reconocimiento en diversas industrias, lo que nos da la oportunidad de desarrollar todo tipo de soluciones y afrontar todo tipo de retos.

Entre las funciones que desempeñarás, se encuentran:


Limpieza y transformación de datos, análisis exploratorio y visualización de datos.
Desarrollo de modelos estadísticos y de machine learning para resolver problemas reales que tengan un impacto medible en el negocio.
Aplicación de tecnologías y metodologías emergentes para ayudar a nuestros clientes a maximizar el valor de sus datos generando aprendizajes accionables que se convierta en verdadero valor de negocio.
Desarrollo de informes de resultados y presentación de estos.
Interacción con el cliente en el desarrollo del proyecto.
Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares para diseñar, implementar y validar soluciones basadas en los datos.


¿Qué buscamos?

Que seas una persona que reúna las siguientes cualidades:


Pensamiento analítico y orientado a la resolución de problemas.
Capacidad de adaptación y comunicación tanto oral como escrita. Presentar resultados complejos de manera sencilla.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
Orientación al cliente y visión de negocio.


Todos estos aspectos son muy relevantes para el negocio de las compañías con las que colaboramos.

Capacidades técnicas :


Grado o Máster en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingenierías, Física o campos relacionados. Valorables otras titulaciones con formación técnica.
Nivel alto de inglés (hablado y escrito).
De 0 a 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo de proyectos de Data y/o Inteligencia Artificial.
Conocimientos sólidos en el uso de lenguajes de programación como Python y/o R. Muy valorable el conocimiento de SQL, Spark o Git.
Conocimientos básicos de estadística, técnicas de regresión, clasificación, clustering y series temporales.
Valorables capacidades de visualización de datos con librerías gráficas como Plotly o herramientas como Tableau o PowerBI.
Valorable conocimientos o certificaciones en plataformas cloud (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).


¿Cómo es trabajar en Deloitte?

🤩 Proyectos de alto impacto donde tendrás un largo recorrido y aprendizaje

☯️ Un día a día híbrido-flexible: tendrás horario flexible y un buen equilibrio entre el teletrabajo y el trabajo en equipo en nuestras oficinas o las de nuestros clientes

⚽ Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutarás de varios teambuildings al año, actividades culturales y deportivas… ¡y mucho más!

🧘‍♀️ Bienestar integral: cuídate con nuestro programa de salud física, mental y financiera… ¡y con equipo médico en las oficinas!

🤲 Impacto social: Podrás apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes más lo necesitan

🗣️ Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecerás en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formación impulsarán tu desarrollo. ¿Ya te visualizas en la Deloitte University de París?

🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:


Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil
Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor


¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.

🧘‍♀️ Bienestar integral: cuídate con nuestro programa de salud física, mental y financiera… ¡y con equipo médico en las oficinas!

🤲 Impacto social: Podrás apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes más lo necesitan

🗣️ Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecerás en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formación impulsarán tu desarrollo. ¿Ya te visualizas en la Deloitte University de París?

🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:

  • Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil
  • Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor

¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.

Title: Research Scientist (Data & ML)
Description:
Sidea Group unisce marketing e tecnologia per supportare i clienti in ogni fase della loro evoluzione digitale: consulenza, strategia, operatività, analisi dei risultati.

Il nostro scopo è far crescere le aziende, contribuendo a generare un impatto positivo sulla società nel suo complesso.

Il fulcro sono sempre le persone: quelle per cui lavoriamo, e quelle con cui lavoriamo. Crediamo nel potere di conoscenza, inclusione, formazione continua e innovazione.

Sidea Group è marketing and technology. With people, for people.

Sidea Group è partner di:

Salesforce

Zuora

Adobe

AWS

Tableau




Sidea Group ha ricevuto la Certificazione della parità di genere del PNRR, a titolarità del Dipartimento per le pari opportunità della Presidenza del Consiglio dei ministri.





Nel nostro piano di Talent Acquisition, è previsto l’inserimento in organico di una persona che andrà a ricoprire il ruolo di Research Scientist (Data & ML)




Tasks

Adottare i metodi della ricerca per la risoluzione dei problemi di business

Applicare metodi quantitativi per lo studio dei fenomeni di mercato e del comportamento degli stakeholder

Analizzare grandi quantità di dati per identificare pattern e trend

Definire e monitorare indicatori sintetici e modelli a supporto delle strategie di marketing

Comunicare risultati mediante presentazioni, documenti tecnici e paper




Job Profile



Laurea magistrale in Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini
Padronanza dei metodi: aver maturato un background consolidato in metodi quantitativi con una conoscenza dei fondamenti di statistica descrittiva, statistica inferenziale, machine learning e deep learning. Possedere buone conoscenze di NLP, modelli di linguaggio (Transformers, BERT, LLMs) e tecniche di text mining
Padronanza degli strumenti: ottima conoscenza di Python e delle principali librerie per l’analisi dei dati, il machine learning e il deep learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Mentalità scientifica: essere autonomi nello studio e nella ricerca bibliografica da testi e articoli scientifici. Agire con precisione e cura dei dettagli nelle presentazioni e nella preparazione dei documenti tecnici
Proattività e pensiero divergente: essere proattivi nello sperimentare approcci innovativi avendo la capacità di pensare fuori dagli schemi. Essere desiderosi di estendere la propria conoscenza di metodi e tecnologie per la risoluzione dei problemi di business
Spiccato interesse nell’applicazione e sperimentazione di nuove metodologie per risolvere problemi e comprendere fenomeni complessi
Conoscenza professionale della lingua inglese




Nice to have

Sarà considerato requisito preferenziale aver conseguito il dottorato di ricerca o avere maturato esperienza pregressa nella ricerca in ambito data science, intelligenza artificiale o statistica







Cosa aspettarsi in Sidea Group

Ambiente di lavoro positivo, stimolante, aperto al confronto e volto all'innovazione e al miglioramento costante;

Inserimento in un team giovane e dinamico;

Coinvolgimento su progetti cross-sector;

Possibilità di lavorare con tecnologie all'avanguardia;

Percorso di carriera definito valutando periodicamente desideri e obiettivi di ciascuno;

Piano di welfare e sistema incentivante;

Percorsi di coaching e attività di team building, per lavorare meglio e non sentirsi estranei fra colleghi;

Possibilità di lavorare da remoto con flessibilità nell'organizzazione delle proprie attività;

Per sostenere la concentrazione, in ufficio troverai per te: caffè, snack, frutta fresca e frutta secca





Luogo di Lavoro: Bari, con possibilità di lavoro in modalità smart working.

Join us! job@sideagroup.com

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03" negli annunci di lavoro. I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (GDPR)

Tasks

  • Adottare i metodi della ricerca per la risoluzione dei problemi di business

  • Applicare metodi quantitativi per lo studio dei fenomeni di mercato e del comportamento degli stakeholder

  • Analizzare grandi quantità di dati per identificare pattern e trend

  • Definire e monitorare indicatori sintetici e modelli a supporto delle strategie di marketing

  • Comunicare risultati mediante presentazioni, documenti tecnici e paper




Job Profile

  • Laurea magistrale in Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini
  • Padronanza dei metodi: aver maturato un background consolidato in metodi quantitativi con una conoscenza dei fondamenti di statistica descrittiva, statistica inferenziale, machine learning e deep learning. Possedere buone conoscenze di NLP, modelli di linguaggio (Transformers, BERT, LLMs) e tecniche di text mining
  • Padronanza degli strumenti: ottima conoscenza di Python e delle principali librerie per l’analisi dei dati, il machine learning e il deep learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
  • Mentalità scientifica: essere autonomi nello studio e nella ricerca bibliografica da testi e articoli scientifici. Agire con precisione e cura dei dettagli nelle presentazioni e nella preparazione dei documenti tecnici
  • Proattività e pensiero divergente: essere proattivi nello sperimentare approcci innovativi avendo la capacità di pensare fuori dagli schemi. Essere desiderosi di estendere la propria conoscenza di metodi e tecnologie per la risoluzione dei problemi di business
  • Spiccato interesse nell’applicazione e sperimentazione di nuove metodologie per risolvere problemi e comprendere fenomeni complessi
  • Conoscenza professionale della lingua inglese


Nice to have

  • Sarà considerato requisito preferenziale aver conseguito il dottorato di ricerca o avere maturato esperienza pregressa nella ricerca in ambito data science, intelligenza artificiale o statistica



Cosa aspettarsi in Sidea Group

  • Ambiente di lavoro positivo, stimolante, aperto al confronto e volto all'innovazione e al miglioramento costante;

  • Inserimento in un team giovane e dinamico;

  • Coinvolgimento su progetti cross-sector;

  • Possibilità di lavorare con tecnologie all'avanguardia;

  • Percorso di carriera definito valutando periodicamente desideri e obiettivi di ciascuno;

  • Piano di welfare e sistema incentivante;

  • Percorsi di coaching e attività di team building, per lavorare meglio e non sentirsi estranei fra colleghi;

  • Possibilità di lavorare da remoto con flessibilità nell'organizzazione delle proprie attività;

  • Per sostenere la concentrazione, in ufficio troverai per te: caffè, snack, frutta fresca e frutta secca



Luogo di Lavoro: Bari, con possibilità di lavoro in modalità smart working.

Join us! job@sideagroup.com

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03" negli annunci di lavoro. I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (GDPR)

Title: Científico de datos
Description:
¿Te apetece unirte al equipo de Mutua Madrileña y formar parte de un proyecto único y en continuo crecimiento?




En Mutua Madrileña estamos buscando incorporar un Data Scientist para el área de Analítica Avanzada e IA donde se desarrollan e implementan modelos analíticos para las diferentes áreas de la compañía utilizando las últimas herramientas de modelización y usando los modelos de última generación como los LLMs.




Se integrará en un equipo joven, dinámico y con talento donde la comunicación, la colaboración y el traspaso de conocimiento es fluida.

Este puesto, en particular, desarrollará sistemas de predicción, motores de recomendación y asistentes de GenAI para distintos equipos de la compañía.




Requisitos:

• Formación: grado/Licenciatura en Matemáticas, Físicas, Ingenieria, Estadística, actuarial... con mucho peso en modelos matemáticos

• 1-2 años experiencia en la implementación de modelos analíticos y/o buen expediente académico.

• Amplios conocimientos de estadística y matemáticas, Python y/o Tensorflow.

• Conocimientos de modelos de Deep learning y en particular de LLMs (GenAI).

• Es imprescindible que le guste programar, el tratamiento de la información y la realización y puesta en producción de modelos analíticos, así como su seguimiento y generación de nuevos evolutivos.

• Se valorará conocimientos en diferentes plataformas para la generación de asistentes (DialogFlow (Google), Salesforce, Microsoft, AIP, ...) y de prompting.




¿Te sientes Preparado? ¿Eres un Valiente? ¡Únete a nuestro reto profesional!




Grupo Mutua es para #PreparadosyValientes. Grupo Mutua es para ti.

Aceptando suscribirte a esta oferta consientes el tratamiento de tus datos personales conforme a los términos y condiciones establecidos en: https://www.grupomutua.es/proteccion-de-datos/




Este es un puesto para Preparados y Valientes:

Preparados para crear impacto en Grupo Mutua: la potencia de una compañía diversificada y líder. Y Valientes para afrontar nuevos retos con una visión transformadora y motivada por la innovación.

¿Te sientes identificado? Grupo Mutua es tu lugar.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
At Exacaster we impact the lives of over 40 million consumers on a daily basis by working with clients in the Baltics, USA, Central and South America and the Caribbean. Overall, we operate one of the largest big-data environments in the Baltics, and we certainly have one of the most diverse sets of data and pursue some of the most challenging analytical projects.

Exacaster’s team is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Genesis team.

About the role:

We are seeking a Junior Data Scientist passionate about working with both generative AI and traditional ML solutions to solve business problems. This role involves assisting when designing, developing, and implementing business processes built on top of AI/ML models. These processes may encompass both back-end and front-end development, with a primary focus on Large Language Models (LLMs).

Who should apply:

This role is for a Junior Data Scientist who is passionate about and eager to learn both Generative AI and traditional data science. We encourage you to apply—even if your experience doesn’t perfectly align with our listed requirements. We value passion, curiosity, and a strong motivation to grow in this evolving field.

Your daily tasks will include:


Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to analyse Generative AI project requirements.
Develop data processes and solutions based on Generative AI models.
Develop and maintain knowledge bases using vector embeddings.
Optimise existing Generative AI processes and models for improved performance, scalability, and efficiency.
Create clear and concise documentation — including technical specifications, user guides, and presentations — to communicate complex Gen AI concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Research to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in Generative AI and machine learning in general.



We are looking for a person who has:


Experience in the Data Science field: Knowledge of data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning (ML) techniques.
Interest in developing and implementing processes based on generative AI models, with hands-on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT-4o, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, and similar.
Proficiency in Python, with experience using GenAI and machine learning libraries and frameworks such as LangChain, LangServe, Streamlit, Chainlit, and others.
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
Interest in working with vector databases and vector search capabilities, such as Pinecone, Azure AI Search, and vector search extensions in relational databases like Amazon Aurora, Amazon RDS, etc.
Problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively to develop innovative AI solutions.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.
A proactive mindset, with the ability to work in dynamic environment on several concurrent projects.



Nice to have things:


Demonstrated interest in Research and Development (R&D): A passion for exploring cutting-edge technologies and contributing to innovative projects.
Experience with RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms and services, such as AWS, Azure, and/or GCP
Proficiency with Git for version control: Experience in collaborative development using Git, GitHub, or similar platforms.
Innovative mindset: Creative thinker with the ability to develop and implement novel AI solutions.



We promise:


Monthly salary for this position from 2627 Eur gross to 3284 Eur gross for a full time role.
Participation in the company’s stock options program.
Flexible Benefits & Personal learning budget.
10 Growth Days per year - dedicated time for learning and development.
Ownership and dynamics in your role.
Hybrid work environment with preferably at least 1 day per week in the office.
Mindletic – the app for your mental & emotional health.
All the support you need from our experienced team to become an even better professional.
And the most important thing – you will be part of a great international team!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking a Machine Learning Engineer to integrate one of our biggest clients in the banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry (Oporto - Hybrid).


You will integrate a Data & Digital Hub which integrates other activities linked to Data Management, Data Protection and Digital Innovation. It makes this department a real end to end center of expertise on data, innovation and technology.


What you will do:

  • Collaborate with clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs in terms of complex AI/ML challenges;
  • Investigate and solve business issues using technical, data-driven, AI/ML strategies;
  • Build and/or adapt AI/ML models: Design and develop Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions, i.e., collect labeled data, setup and train models, test and evaluate results;
  • Work closely with clients during application roll-out and all stages of the application lifecycle;
  • Design the most adequate approaches to solve the identified problems within the company’s framework;
  • Implement and assist the deployment and maintenance of models: Follow to best practices in the industry to implement and scale out the developed solutions into production grade software and Assist the operational teams with the deployment, monitoring and maintenance of the developed solutions.


What you are like:

  • At least, 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer or similar;
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning models;
  • Knowledge of NLP and/or computer vision techniques;
  • Knowledge of deep learning architectures and frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Keras, …);
  • Knowledge of at least one ML development stack (e.g. Scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch…);
  • Knowledge of ETL methods;
  • Effective Programming skills (e.g. Python) and algorithmic knowledge;
  • Fluency in written and spoken English;


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
M/F







DESAFIO:

Procuramos um Data Scientist com experiência, espírito crítico e gosto no contacto com o negócio para integrar a nossa equipa de Data Science. Trabalhamos em projetos para as diferentes áreas da empresa, transformando dados em insights que orientam decisões estratégicas.







O QUE ESPERAMOS DE TI:




Colaboração com as equipas de negócio para entender os desafios e transformar problemas em projetos data-driven.
Capacidade de compreender problemas de negócio, estruturá-los e traduzi-los para soluções técnicas.
Proatividade e autonomia para identificar oportunidades e propor melhorias.
Capacidade para estruturar projetos de forma eficaz, definindo as diferentes fases, tarefas e objetivos em cada etapa, mantendo sempre uma visão estratégica - big picture do projeto.
Gosto pela análise de tendências e utilização de dados para suporte à tomada de decisão.
Habilidade para desenvolver e otimizar soluções baseadas em inferência estatística, machine learning ou algoritmos avançados de IA.
Comunicação clara para apresentar resultados e recomendações às partes interessadas.







PERFIL:

Licenciatura/Mestrado em Engenharia, Data Science, Data Analytics, Ciências da Computação, Matemática, Estatística ou áreas relacionadas.
Experiência comprovada como Data Scientist ou Senior Data Analyst.
Pensamento crítico e abordagem orientada à resolução de problemas (problem-solver).
Sólidos conhecimentos de programação em Python e linguagens de consulta de dados como SQL.
Experiência em trabalho com metodologias Agile, incluindo o uso de repositórios de dados e ferramentas de versionamento para colaboração e gestão de projetos.
Familiaridade com o processamento e análise de grandes volumes de dados.
Fortes capacidades de comunicação e apresentação, facilitando a interação com diferentes stakeholders.







VALORIZAMOS AINDA:

Experiência na utilização de ferramentas de Business Intelligence, como o Excel e PowerBI.
Experiência com plataformas de AutoML, como a Data Robot.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En Desigual llevamos 40 años marcando la diferencia con creatividad, audacia y energía. En 1984, nuestro fundador, Thomas Meyer, transformó unos vaqueros en la Iconic Jacket que dio inicio a nuestra historia. Desde entonces, hemos evolucionado colección tras colección, fieles a nuestra esencia, reinventándonos constantemente y con una mirada innovadora y abierta hacia el futuro.







Cooperation, Fun&Profit, Innovation y Results Orientation, son los pilares que reflejan nuestra manera de ser, trabajar y transformar el futuro. Estos valores inspiran cada decisión que tomamos, impulsan nuestra creatividad y nos motivan a alcanzar resultados con entusiasmo y pasión, siempre en equipo. Buscamos personas que compartan esta visión y quieran unirse a nuestra #DesigualPeople para transformar el futuro de la moda.







Si te consideras una persona flexible e innovadora y te apasiona la atención al cliente, tenemos una oportunidad para ti en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona: Como Data Scientist, contribuirás en la gestión de proyectos de Machine Learning en entorno Cloud, en contacto con stakeholders para desarrollar modelados estadísticos y predictivos.







¿Qué te ofrecemos?




4-day work-week: trabajamos 34 horas dentro de una semana laboral de 4 días para potenciar la creatividad y la conciliación. Además, contamos con teletrabajo y flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida.
Oficinas abiertas al mar: estamos en la Barceloneta frente al Mar Mediterráneo. Las vistas nos inspiran y el entorno nos permite disfrutar de una vida saludable: hacer deporte, llegar en bicicleta o caminando o comer al aire libre.
Podrás flexibilizar tu salario destinándolo a servicios como seguro de salud, transporte, guardería y comida. Además podrás disfrutar de café, infusiones y fruta fresca cada día.
Desigualiza tu armario: tendrás un 50% de descuento en nuestras colecciones.







¿Qué buscamos?




Ingeniería Superior en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática y Telecomunicaciones.
Experiencia de al menos 2 años como Data Scientist
Experiencia en el desarrollo de Modelos Predictivos y de Machine Learning
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas ML (Phyton, SQL, R...)
Nivel fluido de inglés
Habilidades de comunicación, trabajo en equipo, mente abierta
Capacidad de análisis
Capacidad de autonomía y proactividad
Además, se valorará positivamente:

Experiencia con herramientas data discovery y data preparation

Experiencia en el deployment de proyectos de IA/ Machine Learning

Experiencia de forma activa en procesos de transformación de una compañía hacia una Data Driven Company.




Tus funciones principales serán:




Implementar productos Machine Learning en entorno Cloud (Snowflake, Azure, Amazon Sagemaker,..) sobre grandes volúmenes de datos y posterior seguimiento para garantizar la mejora continua de su rendimiento.
Desarrollar y producir técnicas avanzadas de modelado estadístico y predictivo, trabajando en estrecha colaboración con los stakeholders.
Tomar requerimientos con negocio, ejecutar e implantar proyectos analíticos.
Dar seguimiento a todo el ciclo de vida de los proyectos: implicar y coordinar a los equipos internos y externos, estimar los recursos y tiempos para el desarrollo de las tareas, comunicar las soluciones analíticas a los stakeholders e implementar mejoras.
Desarrollar nuevos e innovadores enfoques para resolver problemas analíticos.

Show more

Tus funciones principales serán:


  • Implementar productos Machine Learning en entorno Cloud (Snowflake, Azure, Amazon Sagemaker,..) sobre grandes volúmenes de datos y posterior seguimiento para garantizar la mejora continua de su rendimiento.
  • Desarrollar y producir técnicas avanzadas de modelado estadístico y predictivo, trabajando en estrecha colaboración con los stakeholders.
  • Tomar requerimientos con negocio, ejecutar e implantar proyectos analíticos.
  • Dar seguimiento a todo el ciclo de vida de los proyectos: implicar y coordinar a los equipos internos y externos, estimar los recursos y tiempos para el desarrollo de las tareas, comunicar las soluciones analíticas a los stakeholders e implementar mejoras.
  • Desarrollar nuevos e innovadores enfoques para resolver problemas analíticos.

Title: Applied Scientist
Description:
Company Overview

Docusign brings agreements to life. Over 1.5 million customers and more than a billion people in over 180 countries use Docusign solutions to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives. With intelligent agreement management, Docusign unleashes business-critical data that is trapped inside of documents. Until now, these were disconnected from business systems of record, costing businesses time, money, and opportunity. Using Docusign’s Intelligent Agreement Management platform, companies can create, commit, and manage agreements with solutions created by the #1 company in e-signature and contract lifecycle management (CLM).

What you'll do

Docusign is looking for a passionate, versatile, and inventive Applied Scientist to help build industry-leading, groundbreaking AI/ML solutions. You will be able to get your hands on all aspects of the AI/ML feature life cycle by applying your expertise in NLP and document understanding. You will be building production-level machine learning models that deliver more personalized and automated customer experiences throughout Docusign's new Intelligent Agreement Management (IAM) platform.

This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager, Applied Science.

Responsibility


Work together with your Applied Science team to perform model development, research, testing, and evaluation of existing and emerging deep learning methods and technologies that can be effectively applied to the contract domain
Be knowledgeable in and able to apply the latest architectures and technologies to build Docusign IP and solve complex NLP challenges including, but not limited to, generating representations, text understanding, semantic retrieval, extractions, summarization
Develop an understanding of the technologies, methods and the architecture within Docusign product development
Understand, assist, and improve the existing model training, evaluation, and online inferencing processes, define online metrics, and design user feedback for our AI / ML features
Work closely with the engineering partners to deploy models into production, build scalable AI systems, monitor and improve performance metrics
Work closely with Product Management to translate user scenarios and product requirements into designs and plans for robust, customer-agnostic machine learning solutions


Job Designation

Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation)

Positions at Docusign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within Docusign. Docusign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law.

What you bring

Basic


2+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 1+ years related experience with a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent experience
Experience in designing, developing, and monitoring machine learning and deep learning solutions
Experience programming in PyTorch, TensorFlow, or an equivalent deep learning framework
Experience in the latest NLP techniques including LLMs and language representations
Fluent in Python
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, physics, statistics, econometrics, operations research, applied mathematics or an equivalent computational field


Preferred


Demonstrated experience developing and deploying large scale document understanding models in production
Experience in text extraction techniques, especially using OCR and direct extraction from docx, images, and pdfs
Strong desire to stay ahead of industry trends technologies with a commitment to continuous learning
Extensive experience in data collection, cleaning, sampling, and processing large, diverse structured or unstructured datasets


Life at Docusign

Working here

Docusign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At Docusign, everything is equal.

We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

Accommodation

Docusign is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need such an accommodation, or a religious accommodation, during the application process, please contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.

If you experience any issues, concerns, or technical difficulties during the application process please get in touch with our Talent organization at taops@docusign.com for assistance.

Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Bitdefender

Bitdefender, one of the market-leading antivirus engines, is used by over 500+ million users worldwide. Our technology has been named Product of the Year by several internationally recognized testing organizations. As part of the Data Science team, you will develop and deploy models by leveraging the best tools and approaches to address business needs. You will experiment with different technologies and propose the best approaches to achieve your goals, working closely with the Data Analysis, Data Engineering, and Data Warehousing teams.




This position requires full-stack expertise in text-based generative AI, from prompt engineering, LLM orchestration and agents to training custom RAG components.




Responsibilities

Engage in the full Data Science lifecycle: data collection and preprocessing, model training, deployment, and monitoring.
Stay updated on innovations, tools, and techniques in large language models (LLMs) to enhance internal Data Science methodologies and make use of the best solutions for projects.
Conduct ad-hoc and in-depth data-driven analysis to deliver clear insights and actionable recommendation.Compare models and collect data through experiment design and A/B testing.
Handle multiple projects independently, ensuring well-documented processes and clear decision records.




Experience requirements

Hands-on experience with large language model (LLM) tools and frameworks for prompt optimization, evaluation platforms, and orchestration (e.g. Haystack, LangChain, LlamaIndex), including RAGs and agentic behavior.
Proficiency in classical machine learning (ML) algorithms as well as deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow) and architectures, particularly transformer-based models.
Strong Python programming skills.
Experience in SQL operations and automating data workflows with specialized orchestration tools (e.g. Airflow).
Strong knowledge of statistics concepts (e.g. distributions, regression, statistical testing).
Willingness and ability to learn new mathematical and/or technical methods.




Education

Bachelor/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or related fields.




Nice to have

Hands-on experience with training and deploying deep learning models in production, including serving live predictions.
Capable of translating intricate technical ideas into intuitive terms, with a clear focus on how and why they work.

Title: EU Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: EU Data Scientist

Location: Hybrid, Lisbon

Competitive salary and benefits




Join one of Europe's largest B2B used vehicle service




At BCA, we’re altogether, more. More than just your average vehicle remarketing company. More than just any other place to work. We’re Europe's largest vehicle remarketing business, the backbone of the automotive supply chain.




The BCA EU business is now at an exciting turning point in their ambitions for how data can enhance their customer proposition. This role is part of a significant investment in strengthen the Decision Intelligence capability in the EU business, through a continuous development and maintenance of the Data Warehouse, expanding our use of Data Science & Machine learning solutions, developing new dashboards and fostering the adoption of these tools by the business users, promoting efficiencies and generating added value.




As a Data Scientist working for BCA, you’ll be responsible for the development, maintenance and improvement of our machine learning data products in the EU using our best-in-class framework. Furthermore, from starting with simple proofs of concept through to model refinement and deployment you’ll be involved in the development of new data products for the EU business.

The ideal candidate will have experience of statistical learning approaches e.g regression, tree-based approaches, time-series methods, clustering, etc, and will be innovative in model development and naturally curious, willing to try new approaches.




Solutions will be built using BCA’s best of breed Data Science solution (Python, SQL Server, Git, Databricks, MLflow, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Lake, Azure DevOps Services and Azure Kubernetes Services).







Role Accountabilities:




Ensure the on-going accuracy of BCA’s valuation models through the development of predictive models and machine learning approaches, experimenting with new ideas to further enhance our BCA Valuation product-set.
Utilise models to provide pricing intelligence to key stakeholders ensuring the direction of the market in each country is understood.
Explain the implications of models and model insights to business stakeholders and external customers in an easy-to-understand way.
Be able to identify and suggest new opportunities where the Data Science Team can add value to the BCA EU business.




Knowledge and Experience:




Experience of using a statistical language to build data products, preferably Python or R.
An added advantage is experience with a well-rounded stack of data science libraries, such as NumPy, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Statsmodels, and XGBoost, to effectively clean, preprocess, transform, model, and visualize datasets.
Experience in object-oriented programming and package building is valued.
Knowledge of a machine learning approaches to model data (supervised/unsupervised analysis). E.g. Logistic regression, general linear models, decision trees, deep learning, cluster analysis, etc.
Exposure to data pipelines for both model training, evaluation and reporting/analytical purposes.
Use of cloud infrastructure to deploy model to a production environment would be beneficial.
Experience of using SQL to extract data from source systems.
Interest in data visualization tools, such as PowerBi, for model performance monitoring is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, including the confidence to present to key stakeholders.
Excellent written & oral communication skills, with an ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources.
Strong attention to detail and proactive in identifying and owning issues as they arise.Able to get up to speed quickly in understanding of the business metadata
To question the status quo and suggest possible improvements in the processes (harnessing automation where possible)







Our policy is to employ the best qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.







Thank you for your interest in working for us. Unfortunately, due to the volume of responses we cannot reply to every applicant, if you haven't heard from us in two weeks please assume you have not been successful.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist







Per vincere le sfide del futuro e per affrontare al meglio i grandi cambiamenti che stiamo vivendo, Agos vuole investire su persone dotate di entusiasmo, creatività e che condividano i nostri valori

di innovazione, vicinanza, impegno, spirito di squadra e passione.




La nostra realtà è caratterizzata da una cultura d'impresa unita e intraprendente, in cui le persone sono il denominatore comune e fanno la differenza: per Agos l’inclusione della diversità è un valore, che va coltivato quotidianamente e su cui fare leva per accelerare la trasformazione; così come la sostenibilità, sociale e ambientale, è parte integrante della strategia aziendale e ispira tutte le nostre scelte.




Scopriamo il ruolo:

La risorsa sarà inserita nella Direzione Digital Transformation, all’interno del team di Data Science e seguirà le seguenti attività:

Definire ed elaborare i modelli analitici e predittivi attraverso tecniche di Machine Learning, avendo cura di rimanere in costante aggiornamento rispetto all’evoluzione della tecnologia e dei vari approcci modellistici
Esercitare competenze di problem solving per lo svolgimento di analisi complesse sui dati, documentandone i risultati, gli algoritmi e la metodologia adottata
Adottare tecniche di Storytelling per comunicare con chiarezza al management i risultati e le raccomandazioni di business conseguenti
Sviluppare ed evolvere nel tempo conoscenze del dominio e contest business di riferimento per le analisi da svolgere, interagendo con i Data Steward e Owner per raccogliere, validare e identificare problemi di business che possono essere meglio indirizzati grazie all’analisi dei dati.
Esplorare ed analizzare grandi moli di dati provenienti da diverse fonti disponibili in azienda, strutturate e non strutturate
Collaborare con i team di Data Science e Data Analytics del gruppo Credit Agricole Personal Finance&Mobility




Cosa stiamo cercando?

Esperienza nella gestione e analisi di dati complessi e ad elevata dimensionalità provenienti da diverse fonti
Esperienza estensiva nelle tecniche analitiche e quantitative di problem solving
Conoscenza di Machine Learning e strumenti avanzati di analisi statistica (e.g. Python, R, …)
Conoscenze base su Cloud (AWS/GCP) e Machine Learning Engineering
Applicazione dell’Intelligenza Artificiale Generativa nel contesto aziendale è un plus.
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Almeno 2 anni di esperienza in ruoli analoghi.

Completano il profilo un orientamento all’obiettivo, buone doti analitiche e comunicative.




Cosa offriamo:

Modalità di lavoro ibrida: 50% in fisico c/o sede di Milano e 50% da remoto.
Mensa aziendale e buoni pasto.
CCNL Credito
Formazione continua con l’Academy Agos e LinkedIn Learning




Sede di lavoro sita in Milano, Viale Fulvio Testi 280.




I colloqui saranno effettuati in modalità remota.

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed è aperta a candidati/e di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.
